meanings.definition: To strike or hit with a sharp blow.
meanings.sent1: He whot the ball with his bat.
meanings.sent2: She whot the nail into the wall with a hammer.
meanings.sent3: The chef whot the garlic to release its flavor.
meanings.sent4: The thunderstorm whot the tree with a powerful lightning strike.
meanings.sent5: The boxer whot his opponent with a swift punch.

meanings.definition: Used to express surprise or disbelief.
meanings.sent1: Whot! I can't believe you did that!
meanings.sent3: Whot, you scared me with that prank!
meanings.sent4: Whot, I never expected to see you here!
meanings.sent5: Whot! That magic trick was incredible!

meanings.definition: A sound made by a bird.
meanings.sent1: The whot of the robin filled the garden.
meanings.sent2: I woke up to the cheerful whot of the songbird.
meanings.sent3: The whot of the parrot made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The whot of the owl echoed through the night.
meanings.sent5: The whot of the cardinal brightened the morning.
